content.name: cb_FormalComp
content.label: A formal Complaint has been or is expected relating to care and treatment

content.name: cb_ClinicalIncident
content.label: A clinical incident has been , or is expected to be reported

content.name: tf_NotesOfScrutiny
content.label: Notes of scrutiny of clinical records and other documented information

content.name: tf_MEScrunityNotes
content.label: Notes of scrutiny of clinical records and other documented information

content.name: rbCaseRefToCoroner
content.label: Case to be referred to Coroner

options.label: Coroner does not need to investigate
Coroner has agreed to conduct an investigation/Post Mortem
Death where the bereaved or staff raise significant concern about the care
Death of those with learning difficulties or severe mental health issues, advise LeDeR for LD deaths
Deaths is a specialty, diagnosis or treatment group where an alarm has been raised    (for example and elevated mortality rate, concerns from audit, CQC concern)
Deaths where the patient was not expected to die – for example, in elective procedures
Deaths where learning will inform the providers quality improvement work
Maternal/Perinatal deaths , refer to PMRT team
Child deaths  ( ≤ 18 years of age) refer to CDOP

content.name: rb_DiscussionNOK
content.label: Discussion with informant / next of kin

options.label: Cause of death accepted without any concerns being raised
Concerns raised and addressed without requiring discussion with the coroner
Concerns raised and require to be discussed with the coroner
Cause of death provided before scrutiny or noted above is accepted without change
Cause established by the ME and documented is accepted by the doctor
Doctor and ME have agreed the following alternative cause of death
Death needs to be discussed with the Coroner for reason outlined in ME scrutiny notes

content.name: title_MEDeclaration
content.content:
Medical Examiners Declaration

I confirm that I have carried out an independent and proportionate scrutiny of this death in a way that complies with the relevant local and national requirements

content.name: ReferenceTable
content.content:
Reference

Please refer to guidence notes on the following sections

Infection Risk Plastic Liner Bagging View Washing/Tidying Embalming
TB (INC DRUG RES) R Yes
Pyrexia Unknown Origin returned from abroad B/I/C Yes
Invasive Group A streptococcus C Yes *
Pandemic and avian influenza R *Discuss with consultant Microbiologist and Consultant in Communicable Disease Control
Jaundice recently returned from abroad B *Discuss with consultant Microbiologist and Consultant in Communicable Disease Control
Jaundice (UK) if infection suspected but unconfirmed or no history B Treat as Hepititus B
Bloody RTA/very blood stained B Yes (2) (2) (2)


Procedure may be performed B Blood Risk
Procedure should not be performed C Contact Risk
1 Only by experienced embalmer in appropriate premesis I Intestinal Risk
2 Continue Precautions only if HEP B, or HIV suspected R Respiratory Risk
* Discuss with Consultant Microbiologist and Consultant in Communicable Disease Control N Neurological Risk

html_19
content.content:
Hospital Number Patient Name DOB DOD Form Status
000000000 Pats Name (MSSD Comp) 00/00/0000 00/00/0000
000000001 Pats One (Sent to Coroners) 01/01/0001 01/01/0001
000000002 Pats Two (Coroners Inq) 02/02/0002 02/02/0002
000000003 Pats Three (ME Scrutiny) 03/03/0003 03/03/0003
000000004 Pats Four (Completed) 04/04/0004 04/04/0004
000000005 Pats Five (Worked On) 05/05/0005 05/05/0005
